title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a web application built with Next.js (TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript) for collaborative brainstorming and idea management. This project allows users to create, organize, and vote on ideas within a shared board, making it a valuable tool for project planning and team collaboration, ultimately falling under the broader "project" topic.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML that helps users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This project, designed to improve sleep habits, allows users to input sleep schedules and track discrepancies between actual and desired sleep, providing insights into their accumulated sleep debt.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack project leveraging TypeScript, Express.js, and the Gemini API to create an interactive and engaging experience. Built with Vite.js for a streamlined development process, this application utilizes a combination of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to deliver a user-friendly interface for [add purpose from readme - e.g., personalized AI-driven conversations, streamlined knowledge access, etc]. The repository serves as a demonstration of modern web development practices and the integration of AI capabilities into web applications.

title: resume
description: This repository hosts the source code for my resume, built using TeX for generating a professional-looking PDF and optionally deployed as an HTML version for online viewing. This project showcases my skills in document preparation with TeX and basic web development with HTML, serving as a practical example of my technical abilities and providing a readily accessible and customizable resume template.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that provides a simple and intuitive platform for creating and participating in polls and voting events. This project showcases modern web development practices and aims to offer a streamlined experience for gathering opinions and making collective decisions, perfect for quick surveys or more formal voting scenarios.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository serves as a practical example of implementing a dynamic user interface, highlighting best practices in component architecture, data fetching, and styling within a Next.js environment. It's designed to be a learning resource and a starting point for developers looking to build similar applications.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, aiming to [Assuming from README - e.g., provide a modern and efficient task management solution]. Leveraging modern web technologies, this repository focuses on [Assuming from README - e.g., creating a user-friendly interface and robust backend] for effective [Assuming from README - e.g., task organization and collaboration]. Explore the code and contribute to the development of this project!

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project creating a customizable and interactive event calendar using HTML and CSS for styling. This repository offers a flexible framework for displaying events, allowing for dynamic updates and easy integration into web applications. It leverages core web technologies to provide a visually appealing and functional calendar solution.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern, full-stack IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Supabase. It utilizes Tailwind CSS for styling and provides a project template for tracking and managing physical assets using location data. Key technologies include Next.js for the frontend, Supabase for backend services and data storage, and TypeScript for robust type safety.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS designed as a project to visualize and interact with data from a Robofleet robotics platform. This dashboard allows users to monitor robot status, sensor readings, and task progress in real-time, providing a comprehensive overview of the robotic system's operation.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool, built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and shell scripting, designed to efficiently visualize and analyze ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project provides a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and interpret ROS logs, facilitating debugging and performance analysis in robotics applications.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a comprehensive project template built with Next.js 14 utilizing the Pages Router, TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) for a robust and aesthetically pleasing user interface. This repository demonstrates best practices for structuring a modern web application, incorporating React Query for efficient data fetching and management, and provides a solid foundation for rapid development with typed components and a well-organized codebase. It serves as an excellent starting point for developers looking to build scalable and maintainable applications with these technologies.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project that leverages HTML and Python to create interactive and informative map visualizations. This repository showcases techniques for displaying geographic data, potentially including features like markers, heatmaps, and custom overlays. It serves as a practical demonstration of combining web technologies and data processing for geographic data representation and exploration.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a CRUD application built with Python and Flask, utilizing PostgreSQL for data storage and styled with HTML and CSS. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of web development principles, covering topics such as database interaction, backend logic, and user interface design using Python, Flask, and relational databases.

title: atg-world
description: ATGS-World is a project showcasing a dynamic and interactive web application built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. The project aims to create an engaging user experience demonstrating front-end development skills and best practices.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebooks and Python, contains a collection of projects exploring various financial concepts and analysis techniques. Focusing on practical application, it provides hands-on experience with using Python to tackle real-world financial problems, covering topics such as portfolio optimization, risk management, and financial modeling.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and MUI, leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching. This project demonstrates a robust and type-safe approach to building an online storefront, covering key e-commerce functionalities and showcasing best practices for modern web development.
